reasoning: Cardiac arrest incidence estimated at ~55 per 100k person-years globally based on emergency response data. High mortality makes incidence the primary metric. Significant geographic variation between developed (60-100 per 100k) and developing nations (20-40 per 100k).
source: Myerburg RJ, Castellanos A. (2005). Cardiac arrest and sudden cardiac death. In: Braunwald's Heart Disease. Philadelphia: Saunders.
